payload.description: An FPS/RTS hybrid game powered by the Daemon engine (a combination of ioq3 and XreaL)

commits.message:
Fix double-send of info queries on server refresh

When refreshing the serverlist, the "globalservers" or "localservers"
console command is used to make the engine query the master server again
and rebuild the list of potential servers. The command is buffered and
not executed until after the cgame frame finishes. Meanwhile the cgame
immediately sends trap_LAN_ResetPings and trap_LAN_UpdateVisiblePings
which causes pings to be sent for all the servers in the *old* list. As
soon as the new list arrives from the master, everything on the new list
is pinged as well.

Also ensure that the servers are set "visible" as soon as possible so
that pings will be sent out as soon as possible.

pull_request.title: Fix double-send of info queries on server refresh
pull_request.body: When refreshing the serverlist, the "globalservers" or "localservers" console command is used to make the engine query the master server again and rebuild the list of potential servers. The command is buffered and not executed until after the cgame frame finishes. Meanwhile the cgame immediately sends trap_LAN_ResetPings and trap_LAN_UpdateVisiblePings which causes pings to be sent for all the servers in the *old* list. As soon as the new list arrives from the master, everything on the new list is pinged as well.

issue.title: Modification of the menus
issue.body:
List of the changes/creations :

1. Main menu

- "Colors and symbols" moved to the player options menu
- list of the Emoticons created in the player options menu
- "Movement & Cosmetic" options  moved to a new window.

2.  Ingame menu :

- "Democracy" part moved to a new window
- "Bot" part moved to a new window

4. Global :

- Some spacing problems are fixed
- The text color is now white. It is more readable.
- Design updated ( buttons, ilink)
- Now, there is a space between the emoticons and the text, in the "gameplay guide"

comment.body:
> All in all looks good I think. Do you think you could center the main menu?

Well maybe I can. I need to find a way :)
I can try to do a 'real' centerbar that work for all the window. 


> Very cool!

Thx :) 

> Do you think you could add screenshots?

Do did it :)
There is a  screenshot in my precedent post.
when the cursor is on the button, the text became yellow and there is a lighter grey and a lighter cyan

@illwieckz I put the main menu in the right, then?

issue.title: Fix double-send of info queries on server refresh
issue.body: When refreshing the serverlist, the "globalservers" or "localservers" console command is used to make the engine query the master server again and rebuild the list of potential servers. The command is buffered and not executed until after the cgame frame finishes. Meanwhile the cgame immediately sends trap_LAN_ResetPings and trap_LAN_UpdateVisiblePings which causes pings to be sent for all the servers in the *old* list. As soon as the new list arrives from the master, everything on the new list is pinged as well.

issue.title: Fix double-send of info queries on server refresh
issue.body: When refreshing the serverlist, the "globalservers" or "localservers" console command is used to make the engine query the master server again and rebuild the list of potential servers. The command is buffered and not executed until after the cgame frame finishes. Meanwhile the cgame immediately sends trap_LAN_ResetPings and trap_LAN_UpdateVisiblePings which causes pings to be sent for all the servers in the *old* list. As soon as the new list arrives from the master, everything on the new list is pinged as well.

comment.body:
> Is there a proper fix in daemon instead of waiting a frame for globalservers goes out?

I guess we could add a trap call for refreshing the serverlist instead of using a command.

> 
> Should we always update ping on `/globalservers`? Can we do that instead?

You mean it should automatically send pings instead of requiring trap_LAN_UpdateVisiblePings to be called every frame? Yeah, maybe. These APIs could use a redesign in general but I'm still not sure what would be a good design, so for now I'm trying to improve the situation without any compatibility breaks.
The CI doesn't block anything... code authors have to check the status themselves to avoid submitting broken code.

comment.body: I realized that my code had a regression in that there can be a delay up to 200 ms before UpdateVisiblePings is called for the first time, and rewrote it. I ended up getting rid of the bool and instead have a magic behavior when `rocketInfo.serversLastRefresh == rocketInfo.realtime`

commits.message:
add bot actions build, buildInRadius, buildMain (#2795)

add bot action buildNowChosenBuildable, add file build.bt

pull_request.title: add bot actions build, buildInRadius, buildMain
pull_request.body:
Add three bot actions:

-  `build` makes a bot choose and randomly build a buildable (similar to `roam`)
-  `buildInRadius( SOMETHING, DISTANCE )` makes a bot choose and randomly build a buildable near `SOMETHING` (similar to `roamInRadius`)
- `buildMain` makes a bot randomly build the overmind/reactor (similar to `roam`)

This is the most silly implementation of bot building I can think of. But it is already useful to help new players learn the game.

This includes an example file `build.bt`, which helps in testing this. Choose some `<bot>`, and say `/bot behavior <bot> build`. To make it behave normal again, say `/bot behavior <bot> default`.

Technical details:
- in `default.bt`, make bots spawn as dretch or with machine gun
- enable navmeshes for grangers

comment.body: I don't care one way or the other, but if you want to keep the behavior that the bot stops moving when there is nothing to build, you can use `decorator invert`
